Bone marrow oedema.description: Compared to the mandibular ramus, hyperintense marrow signalling within the condyle on T2w FS or STIR images, and/or hypointense signaling on pre-contrast T1w images without FS.

Bone marrow enhancement.description: Compared to the mandibular ramus, hyperintense marrow signalling within the condyle on post-contrast T1w Fs images.

Joint effusion.description: Increased joint fluid with isointense signaling of joint space compared to that of cerebrospinal fluid on fluid-sensitive images.

Synovial thickening.description: Thickened synovial lining of the TMJ with intermediate signal on T2w images

Joint enhancement.description: Signal intensity of the synovium, capsule, and joint fluid higher than that of muscle on post-contrast T1w FS images.

Condylar flattening.description: Loss of the round or slightly rectangular shape of the condylar head, viewed in the sagittal-oblique plane

Erosions.description: Any irregularity or break of the bony joint surfaces leading to the loss of the smooth continuous surface of the subchondral bone

Disc abnormalities.description: Any abnormality of the articular disk, including flattening, displacement, or destruction
